questions.question: Janet as well as her sisters …………………… well.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with as well as, the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: …………………… she is very rich, she is not very happy.
questions.description: As and since give the reason. Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: When we were kids, we …………………….. go swimming every weekend.
questions.description: Both would and used to can be used to talk about past habits.

questions.question: The sun as well as the moon …………………….. light.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with as well as, the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: She screamed ……………………… she was in pain.
questions.description: As if and as though are used to say what a situation seems like.

questions.question: …………………… he was very arrogant, no one liked him.
He is ………………………. to buy a yacht.
questions.description: When enough is an adverb, it goes after the adjective or adverb modified by it.

questions.question: It is time you ……………………… another place to live in.
questions.description: A past tense is used after it is time...

questions.question: The house was ……………………. beautiful that he decided to buy it.
If you had been careful, the accident …………………………
questions.description: In the third conditional, we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: If you are free in the afternoon, we ………………………. to the movies.
questions.description: In the first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will/can/may + first form of the verb in the main clause.
